U Zagrebu protestovalo nekoliko hiljada prosvetara, štrajk u svim školama u zemlji

06 Nov 2019, 13:20


















Nekoliko hiljada prosvetnih radnika protestovalo je danas u Zagrebu tražeći povećanje plata kroz povećanje koeficijenta složenosti poslova za 6,11 odsto, zbog čega su već 19. dan u cirkularnom štrajku.Istovremeno s protestom u organizaciji učiteljskih sindikata, danas nema nastave u osnovnim i srednjim školama u celoj Hrvatskoj, a pridružili su im se i fakulteti.Protest pod nazivom "6.11. za 6,11 odsto" počeo je ispred Hrvatskog narodnog pozorišta odakle su okupljeni iz cele Hrvatske, noseći transparente, u koloni krenuli prema sedištu Vlade na Markovom trgu, gde je održan glavni deo skupa.Isticali su se transparenti na kojima je pisalo "Zapostavljeno obrazovanje = nepokrenuta Hrvatska", "Kol'ko para, takav transparent", "Mi stvaramo, vi trošite", a okupljeni su nosili i zastave, kape i pištaljke. Predstavnici učiteljskih sindikata nosili su navijačke majice, uz poruku da "predstavljaju najuspešniju reprezentaciju Hrvatske, koja stvara i obrazuje mlade naraštaje"."Poručujemo premijeru Andreju Plenkoviću nemojte dovoditi u pitanje budućnost", rekao je predsednik Nezavisnog sindikata zaposlenih u srednjim školama Branimir Mihalinec okupljenima na Markovom trgu.On je ponovio da sindikati žele da isprave nepravdu prema zaposlenima u obrazovanju."Predsedniče Vlade, prihvatite li naše zahteve vi ste pobedili. Pobedili ste, jer ste osigurali budućnost Hrvatskoj. A ako ne prihvatite naše zahteve vi ste izgubili. Nemojte biti gubitnik, svet voli pobednike", ocenio je Mihalinec.Predsednica Sindikata hrvatskih učitelja Sanja Šprem poručila je okupljenima da nemaju prava da odustanu od zahteva, jer je reč o borbi za dostojanstvo i za status profesije."Nemamo pravo da odustanemo, idemo dalje", zaključila je Šprem.Školski sindikati traže povećanje koeficijenta složenosti poslova za 6,11 odsto, koliko zaposleni u školama zaostaju za drugim javnim službenicima kada je reč o složenosti poslova.Vlada je u oktobru odbila njihov zahtev, ali je u medjuvremenu najavila da će u 2020. u tri etape povećati osnovicu za 6,12 odsto za sve zaposlene u državnim i javnim službama. Sindikati su ocenili da se time ne rešava zaostajanje plata zaposlenih u obrazovanju.U dogovoru s koalicionim partnerima iz Hrvatske narodne stranke, koji su podržavali sindikalne zahteve, Vlada je nedavno najavila da će početi rad na rešavanju sistema koeficijenata u javnim službama, a ako oni ne budu rešeni do kraja juna iduće godine, koeficijent složenosti poslova za zaposlene u obrazovanju bi se povećao za dva odsto.Uporedno sa štrajkom, pre dva dana su počeli pregovori s Vladom a prema poslednjim informacijama konačna ponuda Vlade sindikatima u štrajku očekuje se sledeći ponedeljak.Sindikati su najavili da se štrajk po cirkularnom modelu nastavlja, što znači da su svaki dan u štrajku škole u drugim županijama, a povremeno, kao danas, sve škole u zemlji.

Several thousand educators protested in Zagreb, a strike in all schools in the country

06 Nov 2019, 12:20


















Several thousand educators protested today in Zagreb, seeking a pay rise through a 6.11 percent increase in job complexity, which is why they have been on a circular strike for the 19th day. At the same time as the protest organized by teacher unions, there is no teaching in primary and secondary schools today. A protest called "6.11 for 6.11 percent" began in front of the Croatian National Theater from where they were gathered from all over Croatia, carrying banners, heading for the Government headquarters in Mark Square in a column. where the main part of the gathering was held. There were banners that read "Neglected education = not moving Croatia", "How much money, such a banner", "We create, you spend", and the flags, caps and whistles. Teachers' union representatives wore fan t-shirts, with the message that "they represent Croatia's most successful national team, which creates and educates young generations." He reiterated that unions want to redress education employees. "Prime Minister, if you accept our demands you have won. You have won because you have secured the future for Croatia. And if you do not accept our demands you have lost. Don't be loser, the world loves winners, "Mihalinec assessed. Croatian Union of Teachers Union President Sanja Sprem told the congregation that they had no right to give up their claim because it was a fight for dignity and for the status of the profession. School unions are looking for an increase in the complexity ratio and jobs by 6.11 percent, as far as school employees are lagging behind other public servants when it comes to job complexity. The government rejected their request in October, but in the meantime announced that it would increase the base by 6 in 2020 in three stages. 12 percent for all employees in government and public services. Unions have estimated that this does not address the wage gap in education. In agreement with coalition partners from the Croatian People's Party, who supported union demands, the government recently announced that it will begin work to address the coefficient system in public services, and if they do not be resolved by the end of June next year, the job complexity ratio for education employees would increase by two percent. Along with the strike, negotiations with the Government began two days ago, and according to the latest information, the Government's final offer to the unions on strike is expected next Monday. have announced that the strike is continuing in a circular fashion, meaning that schools in other counties are on strike every day, and occasionally, as today, all schools in the country.
